newsitem.title: DUBAI: Shares in Oman move higher in busier week.
newsitem.headline: Shares in Oman move higher in busier week.

text.p: Oman shares crept higher in more active trade in the week to Wednesday, buoyed by good demand for bank and investment stocks, the Muscat Securities Market said.
It said the index ended at a new high of 188.22 points from 186.79 a week earlier.
Of the 57 companies traded in the week, shares of 21 rose, 11 fell, and 25 were unchanged.
A total of 1.62 million shares changed hands in 786 deals compared to the previous week's 895,000 shares in 461 deals.
The banking and investment sector accounted for 52 percent of total trading value of 3.37 million rials ($8.9 million) from almost 2.15 million rials the previous week.
Oman International Bank closed firmer, at 2.810 rials from 2.700 and Oman Textile Mills moved up to 2.600 rials from 2.510.
Other gainers were Modern Poultry Farms, which finished at 1.340 rials -- up 0.140 and National Biscuit Industries, which ended at 2.300 rials from 2.130.
